case_vignette: A 19-year-old woman, gravida 1, para 0, at 21 weeks’ gestation comes to the physician for a follow-up prenatal visit. At her previous appointment, her serum α-fetoprotein concentration was elevated. She had smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for 3 years but quit at 6 weeks' gestation. Examination shows a uterus consistent in size with a 21-week gestation. Ultrasonography shows fetal viscera suspended freely into the amniotic cavity.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Obstetrics and Gynecology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
Oh, I'm not currently experiencing any specific symptoms myself; I'm just here for a regular check-up for my pregnancy.
Great, thank you for letting me know. Can you tell me about your medical history and any medications you are currently taking?
I used to smoke a pack a day for three years but I stopped smoking when I was 6 weeks pregnant. I'm not taking any medications.
Thank you for sharing that information. Have you had any family history of pregnancy complications or birth defects?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history, so I don't have that information to share.

No problem, thank you for letting me know. Based on the information you've provided, I would like to perform a routine ultrasound to check on the progress of your pregnancy. Would you be comfortable with that?
Yes, that's fine with me.

Great, thank you for your cooperation. I will schedule an ultrasound for you at your next appointment.

Final Diagnosis: Pregnancy check-up.
